articles.title: Mapping Burns and Natural Reforestation using Thematic Mapper Data
articles.authors: Lopez Garcia, M., and V. Caselles
articles.link:
This paper discusses using the satellite Landsat 5 and it's thematic mapper sensor contained onboard. During the late
        1970s and early 1980s, a series of fires burned near Valencia, Spain and charred the landscape of the area. Using the spectral 
        signatures obtained by the thematic mapper and by using a pre-fire control group, we can compare the signatures
        of the areas after being burned to determine the extent of the damage. The control group is of vital importance
        in order to minimize atmospheric interference and other possible sources of error. 
        We can also use this imagery to track the progress of regrowth 
        in burned areas as well.
